data.title: 82-year-old woman dies after vehicle fire on Ohio 207; two men also injured
data.meta_description: The Chillicothe Post of the Ohio State Highway Patrol is investigating a one-vehicle fire that occurred on Ohio 207 near Cattail Road
data.text:
CHILLICOTHE – The Chillicothe Post of the Ohio State Highway Patrol is investigating a one-vehicle fire that occurred on Ohio 207 near Cattail Road in Ross County.

On March 3, at approximately 2:56 p.m., a 2009 Honda Element, driven by Timothy R. Landman, 62, of New Holland was traveling southbound on Ohio 207. The vehicle came to a stop in the roadway once the passenger compartment became engulfed in flames. Landman was able to exit the vehicle after the vehicle came to a stop.

His passenger Linda J. Stinson, 82, of New Holland, was entrapped inside of the vehicle. A bystander Matthew I. French, 51, of Chillicothe noticed the vehicle in the roadway. He assisted Stinson out of the vehicle prior to first responders’ arrival.

Landman and Stinson suffered life-threatening injuries and were flown to Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center for treatment by MedFlight. French was transported by Green Township EMS to the Adena Regional Medical Center for minor injuries. French was treated and released. Landman is listed in critical condition.

Stinson succumbed to her injures as a result of the fire.

The Ohio State Fire Marshal was contacted to initiate an investigation of the fire.

Multiple agencies assisted on the scene including the Ross County Sheriff’s Office, Union Township EMS, Union Township Fire Department, Green Township EMS, Concord Township EMS, Scioto Township EMS, and MedFlight. The roadway was closed for approximately two hours during the investigation. The incident remains under investigation at this time.
